title: Serious Game-Based Learning Environment Design Workshop: Application of Bloom’s Taxonomy

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Game-based learning design capacity development for enhancing social sector job competencies among current practitioners.

learning_goals: Acquire design capabilities to map Bloom’s Taxonomy six levels (Remember-Understand-Apply-Analyze-Evaluate-Create) to game mechanics
Develop game scenarios integrating explicit learning (overt learning) and implicit learning (subtle learning)

Learners can select three strategies (e.g., visual storytelling, interactive elements, audio effects) to enhance the sense of place in virtual environment design within one week and present actionable design prototypes for each strategy.

Learners can design a game-based performance measurement system with five core metrics (e.g., engagement, goal achievement rate, collaboration score) for project-based assessments within one week and submit a final report incorporating team feedback.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
